comments.creator: george.carstoiu@gmail.com
comments.text:
Build identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b9) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b9

When restoring multiple tabs, page names are presented as "about blank" in restore page and as "New tab" in restored session instead of "loading".

Reproducible: Always

Steps to reproduce:
1. Right click "Latest headlines" from Bookmarks toolbar and select Open all in tabs.
2. Kill Firefox (before all tabs load)
3. Start Firefox (restore page should be present)
4. Scroll through list of tabs
5. Select restore session

Actual results:
 - names in restore page are "about:blank" and in restored session "New tab"

Expected results:
 - names in restore page should reflect that some of the pages are still loading (not about:blank as it is now)
 - names of tabs in restored session should be presented as "Loading" (not New tab as it is now)
comments.author: george.carstoiu@gmail.com
